title: Whole Foods, special request
content:
Hello my friends, im designing a blackboard sticker for a basket of whole wheat oatmeal cookies that im selling in Mexico, i want to put the prices and the names of the products in the sticker to show the people that information, so i have a special request for you, i was watching this chalkboard fonts in the whole foods website that looks realy awesomes, but i dont know their names, Can somebody help to ID any of this fonts in the picture, specialy the ones in the left side?

thank you for your help :D

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055447im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-2_6053.jpg)
author: HankScorpio

comments.content:
Did you check the website for embedded fonts?  
If you don't know how to do it, post the URL & someone here can do it for you.  
Given the scale of image, I hesitate to name the chalkboard fonts with certainty, but I expect one or more of our typophiles will give it a shot.  
Don

The one on the right ('CAREERS', 'CONTACT US'...) is one of their exclusiive and proprietary font called 'WMF Sketch Carton', a sketched version of [Scala Sans FF](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-scala-sans/). You'd find some good alternatives browsing fonts tagged ' [sketch](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055447/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Asketch)' at MyFonts.  
For the ones on the left, sorry but can't recognize any. Could be either bespoke or freebies. Having also a look at MyFonts to fonts tagged ' [chalk](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055447/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Achalk)' should be helpful. Google is also your friend. Some searches like ' [best+chalk+fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20141201055447/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.google.com/search%3Fhl%3Den%2526source%3Dhp%2526q%3Dbest%2Bchalk%2Bfonts)' should work perfectly. Many people have posted their best picks.
